caption: I often take my friends to this place with my highest recommendations. I go their often. This recommendation is always successful. The the food there is appetizing and the team is efficient and cooperative. always when we go to this place we have a gorgeous evening.  highly recommended.

On Wednesday, March 17, 2021, my wife and I called to make a reservation for Saturday evening at 7:00pm for a dinner party of four. On Friday, March 19, I again called the restaurant and spoke with an employee to inquire whether a special dietary request could be accommodated. I was assured it could. On Saturday, March 20,2021, at 7:00pm,  my wife, our  two friends and I approached the restaurant and found the door locked, the lights off, and no one answering the phone. Other prospective diners were also standing on the street, visibly agitated -as none of us had received even the courtesy of a text message to inform us of the unscheduled closing. Consequently, we were necessitated to leave and find an alternate choice: on a Saturday night, at 7:00pm, during Restaurant week, and amid a throng of diners responding to the relaxation of Covid restrictions. Obviously, despite having frequently patronized this restaurant in the past, we will never return-nor will our companions, who regaled us with stories of this restaurant’s owner’s past history of questionable business practices, as we dined at another restaurant several hours later that evening. These people do not DESERVE to remain in business.

My girlfriend and I decided to try Vermilion for Restaurant Week last night, as we had heard it was delicious. We picked up two dinner orders at $39 each, and brought it home.  All we received was a small container with seven small pieces of butter chicken (lots of sauce), what looked like a spoonful of rice (not even enough for one), a small portion of fruit, two small arepas, and two types of naan. The food was good, but the amount of chicken was definitely not enough for two people!  ...especially for $78...  I thought they would’ve, at least, sent two orders of the butter chicken.  After calling the restaurant, the woman told me she was sure that amount was correct, but that a manager would call me back. No one called. When I tried to call back today, I can’t even get through. It goes to voicemail - all three times. I definitely will not be going back to this restaurant, and am disappointed with the service.

Really bad service here. Didn't even get my order put in. All the customers were so surprised at how bad the service was. I was there for 35 minutes just to be asked if they took my order. I work in the industry and understand when a place is bad understaff but this place really did not do much to provide us with any normal type of service. A restaurant managed like this does not deserve my business. I read reviews and always want to give places benefit of the doubt but I seen similar reviews that date back months. What a waste of time and having to drive and pay for parking for a night out as out first restaurant week on the list place. Cost me more for the trip and wait time for nothing. Hoping at least the food is awesome cause menus sound amazing but I would give this place 0 stars . I felt bad writing this review being a chef but I'm also a customer. And I read over other reviews and this seems to be a very common trend with late food and bad servers. I do not recommend and would not even want to go back if the meals were free and paid vacation.

It was our first visit to Vermilion. I’m so disappointed with the service. We waited for about 20 minutes to even get water on the table. The achari chicken was served without its accompaniment. I requested for it. The server said she would get it. But there was no sign of her for several minutes and the accompaniment was not served eventually. They charged us for an item that was not ordered by us. When we asked the server to get the check corrected, she kept us waiting for so long and came back asking us what we were waiting for !! She basically forgot to even get the check corrected. The food quality was below average, especially the butter paneer which had a watery texture. Overall a horrible experience.

Made a Grubhub order for delivery. Food is good but the portions are insanely small. $18 for butter chicken that literally looks like a kids portion with 4 pieces of chicken. $24 for mutton curry same thing. Will just stick to Indian buffet next time.
Ordered for delivery. Mutton curry and pani puri were the best but all of it was excellent. Very flavorful and good (not excessive) portion sizes. Excited to order again!

We ordered take out dinner and cocktails recently. It was definitely one of the surprisingly delicious find in Indian fusion. All of the dishes were A+. We ordered artichoke pakoras, a grilled cauliflower kebab, pindi butter paneer and rice bowl with chicken. All of the dishes were more than satisfying. Cocktails (paani puri margarita and lychee caipirinha) were amazing too. Definitely recommend this restaurant and waiting to dine-in soon.

Their food is hit or miss. Chicken is great,  steak is overvinegared and lacking. 3 stars for food. What I was appalled by is the fact they were clearly understaffed. The one FOH person on NYE was working incredibly hard, doing the best he could,  while the manager was messing around on his cell phone, offering no direction or help. I can only assume the situation in BOH was similar considering how far behind they were.

We booked a reservation through Opentable for New Years Eve. We called the restaurant up an hour before our reservation to check if valet parking was available. On calling, we were informed that the restaurant is closed and their was an error on Opentable and there is no dine in available. They ruined our New Years plan while we were all excited to enjoy a good meal at there outdoor patio. The worse - they didn’t even have the courtesy to inform, text or call and let the customers know of the screw up at their end. Pathetic customer service.

Vermilion has become part of our regular rotation for many reasons.  First of all, the food is OUTSTANDING.  Even thou they’re classified here as an Indian restaurant, they’re a fusion of Latin and Indian with the greatest combinations you can think of.  The Empanadas are some of our favorites, along with Gobi Portuguese (cauliflower with yellow curry sauce).  This place is a must if you like either Latin or Indian.  And especially if you like a fusion of both.  100% recommend this place.
Filled me up. Bring your hunger - portions are filling. Feels similar to a cafe in Chicago I liked.
Went there on a Saturday. The staff was friendly and sociable. This place has a great design. Food is similar to a cafe in Portland I liked.
Love love LOVE Vermilion! The cocktails are so inventive and delicious, and the food is incredible! I love the idea of mixing Indian and Latin cuisine, and they execute it so well.
The service was great. This restaurant is not your typical Indian place. Lot of fusion dishes. Definitely we’ll come back soon.

I've got to say, I was quite impressed. I don't know how folks think this place doesn't have Indian food, because it has that and more.  The sous chef is from Kerala (area in South India) and the head chef is from Morelos, Mexico. The dishes reflect the vibrancy & intimacy of the flavors present in both cultures, with specific nods to each individually as well.  They are taking the utmost care as far as sanitation & health/safety are concerned. Everything sanitized, barriers between tables, staff is tested for COVID EVERY WEEK, which is even more than I can say for some folks I know in medical professions right now. Sounds like they will have outdoor heaters & air purifiers soon as well for the colder months ahead.  Overall, really conscientious staff as well. Beautifully redone interior & diverse menu. Definitely 5 stars. Best birthday dinner I've had in a long time, and that's saying something in 2020!!!
Don’t waste your time

There is nothing indian about this place, qe order pani puri, we gor 6 puri for 12 buks, and we order bhel, and that was burned lef, that had no teast...there really no food here other then non-veg, even that has about 2 options only.....if ur looking for a Indian food go somewhere else but here. I would give the service good but food i would give it a zero 🌟  if it was possible
nothing to complain about. there was fast and courteous service.
Out of bottled wine    Really uncomfortable too hot to sit    No one in restaurant at 7pm Sparse chairs and table  menu limited now    Not same restaurant from six years ago

I celebrated my birthday yesterday in this great restaurant. I am glad to say that we passed a enjoyable evening and the place was certainly the reason for this happy celebration. The waiters  helped in a very nice manner, the food was great and my buddies were extremely  cheerful. We shall absolutely return for more celebrations. Thank you very much.
Good entrée and desert, salad could have more humf!

I am slowly getting into Indian food and I would say that Vermilion was pretty good. Our server was very patient with explaining the menu during Chicago Restaurant Week. The appetizers and complimentary naan and fries were great. My friends and I all had the mutton (goat). It was okay, but my mind was probably made up due to me being Jamaican and growing up eating curry goat. The dessert was not tasty at all. However, my biggest complaint about the restaurant would be their portion sizes. I would call this place a tapas bar. I see it more for tasting/sampling foods, rather than going for an entree. So I also thought that it was extremely overpriced. However, the presentation of the food was beautiful.

The food was good. I liked the Artichoke pakora. The Tandoori prime rib was phenomenal! I also loved the garlic forward spinach. The only reason it's not five stars, is because service was slow though we were a larger group.
We had an extraordinary time in this restaurant. We liked the first-rate ambience and the meals. The staff members are super welcoming. I’m happy we finally decided to eat here.
Ok food. A bit on the pricier side.  Spices are a bit uneven and a bit all over the place. Desert was the best item on their menu.

I arrive at this outstanding place once a month because I love the ambiance that is outline this place. The personel is very attentive and experienced. The service is certainly rapid. Also, the food they cook is first-rate. I came more than once and I was never disappointed. The payment is honest. I highly recommend this place to my friends and family.
This spot offers great service and enjoyable meals. One of the best spot in town. The meals came out quickly and the rates were inexpensive. Highly recommended.
Awesome food... the fusion of both cuisines are exquisite. Real Indian flavors with a twist of latin ingredients. LOVE IT !!!!!

We met with friends at this place for a meeting. my friend recommended this restaurant.  Well, we were not disappointed. The staff members welcomed us with a smile and we felt very good. The meal was great. We had a great time and we will definitely return to this restaurant. we highly recommend this place.

My frnd took me to this place.i kind of have mixed review about t his place the choices in vegetarian dishes were limited may b 6 or 7 so i was little unhappy about  it cos my frnds who eats meat had alot of options for them.so i ordered hara kebab and dum aloo Kashmiri,both the dishes were outstanding and the service was awesome i loved the place,please include more vegi dishes would love to try them, even the prices are fair enough in regards with the location and other nearby restaurants.
Outstanding food!!!!! tangy crispy tamrind panner butter chicken n kerala mutton curry was awesome and very good service too. Not a typical Indian restaurant, a must try place

I like to go with friends to this place with my warmest recommendations. I go their often. This recommendation is always successful. The meals are tasty and the team is attentive and cooperative. Every time  we go to this place we enjoy a lovely evening.  I recommend this place with pleasure.
Great food and giod ambiance

I went with a group of colleagues for dinner and it was a great experience. Staff was friendly and helpful and the food was great. We weren't sure what to expect, but we enjoyed every dish. I recommend shared dishes to try a number of different meats (or veggie options) and flavors. Everyone had a favorite! Food is priced similar to other restaurants in the area.

Me and my wife walked in on a Friday night the place was little busy still service was really good. the cocktail i had was outstanding.food was awesome too i had stuffed chili with mole and mutton curry, i loved the food, nice combination of flavors. now about the restaurant the ambiance was out of the world n my wife loved it, the pictures on the wall were like celebrating woman hood. The only odd thing about this place was that the servers were dresses up like either  they were going for a party or coming from a party i feel that this place should really work on their working attire.
The shaami kebab they have is the best i had from a very long time and the steak and lobster combo is absolutely delicious and value for money. Please add few more kebabs in the menu.

definitely an underrated place, the food is awesome n service was excellent.we were a group of 6 people And it was our 1st time here . We ordered the kebab platter and all the kebabs were delicious.as we were sharing i had little bit of all the main courses and i loved the butter chicken and the dam aloo Kashmiri was fabulous. only complaint i had was that the food came late but definitely it was worth the wait, will b back soon to try the other stuffs they have!
It is Indian fusion, with that in mind the food was delicious! It was fresh, very delicious flavors. This place has a great atmosphere and good service.

This is not your typical Indian place. Lot of fusion and 'interesting' dishes and combinations.  Did enjoy the decor, ambiance, the presentation; BUT the food and flavor was just OK. Nothing  to rave about.
Very testy food. Bust little pricey. I have ordered kashmiri aloo and test is awesome but qty as per price very less.
(Translated by Google) Very good  (Original) Muy bueno
over priced for the taste it serves
Fancy and expensive restaurant with less than mediocre food and service.

Bad ‘Indian’ food. Thought this place is associated with Maneet Chuhan. It is not. She apparently just opened it. Food is bad. There was hardly anyone there on a Friday night. That itself should have told us not to visit. Skip this place
Rachel is so kind PERIOD! The food is incredible PERIOD!
Had heart of palms n steak, it was absolutely amazing.nice ambiance cheerful servers n good food.will be coming back again!!!!
Honestly after looking at all the mix reviews i was little scared to try this place... but the food s really good n flavored... i was with my girl friend even she liked the place...

me n my 4 frnds had dinner here.... n it was a very good experience... they have some awesome cocktails... nice indian food wit a different touch... v all enjoyed dinning at vermilion... but sad to c a place like this half empty on a Friday eve

My first visit to Vermilion was 6 years ago. I remember being impressed by the fusion selection, the flavors, and the ambience which exuded a cool eclectic vibe.  My second visit was last weekend. Ours was the only party dining at 7:00pm on a Saturday evening - it was odd, and perhaps a bit sad to have the place all to ourselves.  Our server apologized for not being able to accommodate two of our selections (they ran out of batter, apparently). The entreès we ordered lacked a balance of flavors, and had a stale but just heated quality.  A disappointing dining experience. On the slightly bright side, the Farrokh Chotia black and white photographs on the walls still exude a sensual vibe.
Service is always super even when they have a full house. I will probably become a regular. Bring your appetite because portions are generous.
honestly my favorite evening place. certainly worth a return visit. the bill was appropriate. if it was closer to my home i would be here often.

Little disappointed considering the fact that the value for the buck is not quite there. This is definitely not the go to place for wine. We ordered quite an expensive 250$ + wine bottle and it felt like some cheap wine from a local grocery store and that too, it was not taken care off well. Food was below average for the price you pay and when we reached there the whole place was empty - even though the online reservation system showed it’s full - so something weird is going on there if you book slots for 6+ people

Staff was a bit rude. They seemed to be upset since we showed up a bit early, and though they had tables that were vacant, they did not seat us till our time of reservation. We were a party of 5, so not that difficult to accomodate. It seemed like we were being punished for showing up early!! We even contemplated going to another restaurant, but since we did not have reservations, we stayed. The food is a fusion of India and Latin America. The food is a bit of a hit and miss. Some of the dishes were absolutely great, while some kept you wondering on the taste. The portions for the appetizers and the main course were small, so you really could not have a second chance at tasting if you could not figure out the taste! Some of the items on the menu were not available. We were told that they were "out" of some of the items on the menu as it had been a busy day. We had reservation for 9 pm (showed up at 8:40 pm). I have never heard that from a restaurant before, and that too for wines as well. I am told that there are a number of options in Chicago for Indian food. Maybe we should have stuck to a more authentic Indian restaurant. Not sure if I will revisit this place if I am in Chicago again, purely because of the attitude of the staff. Overall we did not have a great experience at Vermilion. Stick to more authentic Indian or Latin American restaurants, and there are plenty of these in Chicago,  unless you want to be treated as trash.
Excellent service and great food..
(Translated by Google) Cozy, friendly staff and very well trained. Good food and nice atmosphere.  (Original) Acolhedor, com staff simpático e muito bem treinado. Bons pratos e ambiente agradável.

I loved the food here. 3.3 is definitely an undervalued rating for this restaurant. They gave us a 3 pepper soup taste on the house and that was delicious. The lamb shank nihari was amazing. (So so good!). There’s so much yum food on the menu, we definitely didn’t try everything we wanted to. The lamb chops were great as was the lobster coconut curry. My husband enjoyed the chimichurri steak as well.
Okay overpriced food

This one of the worst Indian restaurant in Chicago. I went with my family. Their Menu had very limited and stupid dishes. I would give zero ratings. They should stop serving. India House is million time better place than this lousy joint.

We went for the first time here today on St Patrick’s day. We were sober and wanted to try the Indian Latin fusion this place boasts . Man!! All the dishes were so delicious and amazingly cooked to best of its taste. Drinks were so awesome. We tried bucket pani poori drink and mango mojito. For food, we had kale bhel, saffron hen dish, Brazilian seafood with indian  Latin fusion . We liked all the dishes so much. We savored every bite of it. The only con is the service, which is a bit slow.
Really tasty menu. Everything I've had, whether appetizer wise or main course, has been delicious. The ambience of the inside and decor is on point, too.
Beautiful restaurant great service. I can't wait to go back.
Great place. I enjoyed the food. I will be back next week.
Very average Indian food offered. I definitely enjoyed my visit and the food but nothing that was outstanding and nothing that would make me go back there. The ambiance is super weird.
My husband and I had a great time. Service and food was amazing.

Make sure you leave plenty of time to review their extensive food, dessert and drink menus. Everything on the menu is great and worth trying.  I took my wife for her birthday and we both enjoyed our food and drinks. Staff were phenomenon and service were excellent.  Good atmosphere, plenty of space, friendly staff.  Service is a fast and prompt. They have a great luxury atmosphere with a good food and drinks.  I will definitely recommend this great restaurant.

I would give zero star if I could. I took 15 of my colleagues for a holiday dinner in December and it was a total embarrassment. I don't write any reviews online but I'm forced to considering the money we spent: nearly $900 (yes, nine hundred US dollars) for what I think is HANDS DOWN the WORST FOOD in ENTIRE NORTH AMERICA in my last 10 years of business travel. This is nothing more than a well decorated place with a fancy name. All the appetizers served to us were cold that made us wonder if they were ordering food from another restaurant. The main course were served so late that some of the colleagues had already left. All the food served were tasteless, had no flavor whatsoever, half-cooked, breads so hard and what not... absolutely horrible. They food was served in a themed dish but does anyone care if they taste so bad? I have called the restaurant to share my grievance; they took my number and promised to call back to discuss but never they did. IF YOU ARE TAKING SOMEONE HERE FOR A TREAT, SKIP IT AT ALL COST TO AVOID A TOTAL EMBARRASSMENT.
Upscale "Indian" food!
Great food and service. I will recommend to everyone. Specially, loved the butter chicken.

Came here for the second time tonight with my family. It was wonderful. Service was friendly and food was hot, fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The restaurant did not take cash, which was odd and inconvenient. Other than that it was a wonderful experience and we plan to come back.

Great dinner!  My wife and I came here for a date night. She has been wanting to try it, but I was a little nervous because of the mixed reviews online. In our experience it was delicious. The food was high quality with interesting and balanced flavors. The service was great, and the portions were good too - we shared 2 starters and 2 entrees, and left feeling full (but not overly so).  Will definitely come again!

One of the worst experiences I've ever had at a Chicago restaurant - I'll explain clearly what happened. This is the first time I'm ever leaving a negative review because it was so bad. This place has no idea what they're doing. Went here on a date.  Was served water in a glass that was clearly not clean (large residue from some other beverage on the glass). Stayed, assuming it was just a mistake.  Waiters did not write down our orders and came back several times asking us questions about what we ordered. Assumed the waiter was new and tried to enjoy my night.  Was served the wrong food - served me a different meal than what I ordered, charged me for it, and then asked if I wanted to switch.  After I paid, my credit card was not returned until I personally asked for it (it was on floor of the kitchen).  Never ever go here. The worst service ever. I should have not even paid.

We went for a Team Dinner on 19th Dec, the Service was awful, eventhough the Restaurant was pretty much empty they took 1.5 hrs to get our Order served. The Food was bland and tasteless basically. It was supppperr expensive and totally not worth it. I recommend to not go to this place.
Delicious Indian/Latin cuisine with great service and nice ambience. Highly recommended. Everything we ate was wonderful!
Went on new year's Eve and the host was an absolute jerk. Ordered food but never received and the host kept shouting abuses at everyone. Will not recommend this place
The new year eve party was below 1 star. They kept the entry fee cheap and exploited the customer over the bar counter. The DJ was a complete disaster. Ever never go this place

It's the worst New Year celebration I ever had in my life. It's not even worth a dollar. These guys brought a worst DJ who don't even have a collection of songs to play, sound system and DJ system(I didn't knew that even such kind can be called as a DJ). I would have really appreciated if u have brought atleast some Kids to take care of the dj. They don't even know how to organize an event. I don't know how they planned to serve some hundreds of customers with 2 bartenders and a fu#*@*# dj. They don't even have a clue of bollywood ni8. Useless event. I will Never Ever Even imagine to pass by this restaurent. These people are very greedy and pulled in a huge crowd exceeding the max limit with out proper ventilation which has ended up forcibly closing the event by cops.

It’s worest newyear  experience I ever had. Dj is WOREST not at all playing the good songs.unprofessional dj player in the town and he was playing recorded songs. Coming to the management it is even WOREST I waited for 1 beer for 25 mins completely wasted my time.where the party schould last for 4am but they closed by 1:45 am. Where they were rude and yelling the words which can’t be  describe  . Completely waste of time and money and WOREST experience. I will never never never never visit this place again and not even dine in.I suggest not to visit this place.

I went here with my friends for new year event it was worest experience and waste of time the dj was horrible and not at all professional he was playing the recorded  same loop songs.  where the party should last for 4am as mentioned but they have closed at 1:45am it was pathetic . And they were using badwords(m***** f*****s) which is not at all acceptable. Never ever visit this place  not even for dine in.

well what to talk about this place. The new year party organized was big time mess. After all i can say that is not even party which was not organized well. DJ was worst of the worst as he played recorded songs repeatedly. (i was there from 11:50 PM till end).  DJ did not do his job and used abusive words. i didn't want to post but (have to so that every one knows). He literally said "to get the f**k out" and M*****F*****s. you just can't say these when are you are organizing new year event. You can say in a polite manner to handle any kind of situation. He mentioned that the cops asked them to shut down. We had a word with cops and they didn't had anything to do with this.They advertised saying the club is open until 4AM but they send every one out by 1:45 AM.  I will never come to this place again if they ever host any party and even for restaurant as well, thinking they will behave in the same way.

This review is specifically for New Year Party organized by Vermilion Chicago. I haven't been to this restaurant for regular dine-in but the party organized was completely a mess. The organizer outsourced the contract to a 3rd party who owned the DJ and coat check. The restaurant still owned the drinks (bar) and food. Both the sides had no sync and the customers were at a loss as to where to go and what to do.  DJ was pathetic who played pre-recorded Bollywood remixes from YouTube. Speakers blasted our ears coz the acoustics of the dance room was horrible (well that's what it happens when a restaurant tries to earn some extra bucks in new year by arranging a DJ night which they got no clue how to pull it off). Started off by 11:35 when all the other clubs were playing at their peak. Announced the NY late by 3 mins and the countdown didn't sounded energetic anyways.  Didn't ate any food but the bar service sucked big time. A single order of beer took 15 mins and there was a line waiting for their orders. Beer wasn't even chilled, figured they didn't had time to put them in freezer yet wanted to bluff customers by telling them it's chilled.  The cherry on the cake was the event organizer misbehaving with my friend and threatening him on calling cops and throwing him out when he simply complained on bad music, delay in food service, poor quality of sound and lighting error.  Overall 1 star just for the masala fries. Failed attempt of arranging such event. I wouldn't go back to this place even for dine-in.

Worst experience ever. We have been here for new year party which is supposed to last till 4 am according to the tickets we purchased and these guys stopped the party abruptly at 1:30 am and asked everyone to leave in a very rude way using abusive language. As we have paid money for this party and deserve to know the proper reason for the change of plans. Instead of being sorry for what they have done, they were literally yelling at everyone and kicked them out. We had a bad bad bad experience on the first day of new year where we are supposed to have a happy day.  PLEASE DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE EVER. Not even for food.
DO NOT ATTEND NEW YEAR PARTY OVER HERE. They are so mean and they treat you really bad. Very bad experience.
Man this needs a lot more better assessment at what they can do.

They organized an event on NYE and I made the mistake of going there. Ordered some food and was not delivered one dish. Kept asking for the same and did not get it. Plus the event organizer, saala Gaitonde ki chaathi aulad, thinking himself to be God comes and says I will have you thrown out by security when I asked about the remaining dish and the lighting for the event. This was advertised as a club level event and even the lights were not turned down. The music, again by the same person, was monotone and were not dance numbers. You dare to call yourself a DJ but playing copies YouTube tunes and full Bollywood numbers doesn’t make you one. Event started late.  Vermillion , you advertise yourself as a classy restaurant, but this was nothing but a third rate and pathetic representation of your values in the form of this event.  I liked the fries!!

BAD service. Forget about the quality of food. Not sure why there is only one person doing everything and not sure whether it’s prepared fresh or not as the food is so cold.  Lamb and mutton are like undercooked.  Spent 900$ for 15 folks and we are really disappointed...  Never gonna suggest for anyone...

I went tonight for a friends birthday. I loved it! They made her feel so special from roses petals on the table to a happy birthday plate. She is vegan so this was the perfect place for her. DeAndrea was so nice and helpful. I will come back!
Host checking in coats was not pleasent at all. No smiles. Seemed rude.
Wonderful food.  Great vegetarian options.  Amazing flavors.
Ambiance is great. Food is OK. Not for those who love authentic Indian food.
(Translated by Google) Delicious Hindu Food  (Original) Deliciosa comida hindú
Just a phenomenal experience with food, ambience and service at a tasting menu dinner. Would give my highest recommendation.
Loved every dish we ordered and pani poor margarita and wine infused with cinnamon and cloves .
Disappointed with the food and service.
Came here with my roommate as we explore new places in River North. It has a beautiful atmosphere, very first date and sensual vibe. The food here and the service were wonderful as well.

We waited for 1 hour to be served our food when the restaurant had 3 tables to feed including ours, total of 7 people! When the food came in it was beyond bad. I can make better dosa and Frankie at home and in definitely less than 1 hour for even 7 people. Never going back.
So disappointed.. the two waitresses were really sweet and accommodating but food was not up to par. We sent two dishes back because they were raw... Really amateur mistakes.
The best Indian food in Chicago downtown.

First off, the food is more Indian fusion so if you're not into that keep looking. I thought the food was very good and took pictures, however the red lights littering the back wall made the pics unusable. Oh, I grabbed a drink from the bar (forgot the name) made with spicy green peppers. Here's a tip, drink it from the skinny straws otherwise your lips will hate you.

Went on a very highly regarded recommendation. Service was amazing. Very thoughtful and polite and overworked. Twenty people for one person and then she had a mishap. She went to the kitchen where the sackless chef began to berate her at the top of his lungs. Then the food came. If you like bitter food that makes your jaw pucker then this place is for you. Chef should be ashamed and that waitress should tell him to shove off.
Good food

Excellent appetizers - we had the Venezuelan duck arepas, grilled Peruvian octopus, and toasted coconut shrimp. My wife got the plantain crusted whitefish.  I got the lobster portuguese with goan gravy, coconut rice, and eggplant.  We all enjoyed the Taj Mahal beer.  The ambience was really nice and the service was really attentive .  The appetizer portions did seem a bit small for the price, but is really my only complaint.
Nice food but expensive

We had an excellent time! Saturday night at 8 it was quiet and personal. I took my parents for their 32nd wedding anniversary and the chefs brought out a personalized desert. They entire staff made us feel welcome and comfortable.
Go only for ambience, music. Very expensive specially considering quality, taste and quantity. Just to set clear expectations, I went there only once on friday arternoon.
Waited over an hour for drinks. Almost two hours for food. Not worth the price nor the wait.

This is an amazing place to try the indo-fusion appetisers. All appetisers on the menu are great, main course comes in a tiffin box but is average. The ambience is fine but service is so slow that I ended up staying 3 hours in the restaurant. Worth a try for the appetisers.
Really good food. The ambiance is very classy and tasteful.

Arrived around 5:30 and ordered before any other parties arrived. We were there for two hours because the service took so long, and we never got one of our entrees. The food was pretty good, and they were nice and removed the entree and one drink from our tab, but the service was too slow to warrant coming back.

8/13/12: I really had high hopes for this place after everything I had heard and all the hype surrounding its famous chef-owner. When we got there around 8:30 on a saturday night the place was almost empty.  The server was extremely friendly and gave us great tips for ordering from a menu that looked a little strange to us coz of the all the weird fusion stuff going on. So we were off to a good start.  For drinks we had a lychee ginger martini, a cucumber mint martini and mango mint mohito. The drinks were definitely top-notch and extremely delicious!!! So 5 stars there for sure!  For the appetizers we shared the "degustation of  4 appetizers" which includes about two bites of 4 different dishes that the chef chooses. On this day there was a duck appetizer, which neither of us are fans of, so we got the chicken doubled  and we had two other different vegetarian dishes. One was pani puri and the other was artichoke something. These were all awesome!  The main course is where things started to go downhill. We ordered butter chicken and the goat mutton. The butter chicken was great, but lets get real, butter chicken is very hard to screw up (even if you try it at home, its pretty easy. Takes forever, but still easy). The goat mutton was not so great. It was way too spicy (even for indians), some pieces of the mutton were overcooked, some were undercooked. Even the pieces that were nicely cooked were very unsatisfying. I ended up not eating most of it and just ate the butter chicken. Both these entrees came with naan, which was also extremely disappointing. It really didn't have that fresh naan feel or taste to it.  The dessert was the worst part. There was actually a chocolate cake on the menu with some type of chili masala. Are you kidding me???? More spice? I think by the time we get to the dessert most people have had enough spice. None of the other items on the menu looked appealing at all. Once look at the dessert menu and we just asked for the check.  Even without the dessert, we had spent wayyy too much money. I dont think we would come back here. Definitely not with a group, coz you'll end up paying a small fortune to feed more than 4 people. Its a nice place if you want to try something new. But if you're going here to satisfy your craving for 'modern' indian food, you will probably leave unsatisfied. If you're from the suburbs its definitely NOT worth the trek downtown. There are much better options in the burbs, in every burb.  Heck, there are much better options downtown as well.
Paneer was tasty and the steak!

I wish I took a photo of my dinner, since Vermilion is absolutely delicious. It's a bit pricy, average meals will run you $25 apiece. However, barring the price, the quality of the food is top notch, and they have options for all types of diets (vegetarians AND vegans). I had the butter chicken, and it was incredible. The food isn't overwhelmingly spicy either, so if you can't tolerate spice the restaurant can offer you many options. Since the food is made from scratch, expect to wait at least 20 minutes for your food (it is DEFINITELY worth the wait, trust me).
One of the best fusion foods we ever had on our celebration of Valentine's Day. I definitely recommend this place. Five stars.
Very slow service. And the food does not live up to the wait. The price/taste/ambience equation doesn’t hold. Avoid.
Very cool fusion resturant. Service alittlr slow, but worth it because of the creative food. My favorite is the tandoori steak.
Excellent service and food!  A long time favorite.
Horrendous service. Some members of our table never got their food before we just gave up, paid and left. (2+ hours later) If you read other reviews you’ll notice this is a trend.

The only reason I am giving them 1 Star is because the food was decent. The service was bad. It took 2.5 hours to get our food, was a horrible experience.   They said sorry for the delay and would not charge us for the appetizers (but we never got the appetizers). I do not recommend.
How is this place not out of business?!  Stay away!  Otherwise be prepared for horrible delays in service and a comedy of issues like appetizer coming out after finishing desserts.

The golgappa cocktail is one of the best drinks I've ever had. What's not to like, golgappas and alcohol. The kebabs are good, the butter chicken so so. Overall I really liked the place and will definitely return. They ran out of mutton (we ordered the curry) but made up for it with chickpea fritters and a drink on the house
Best place to take your wife for a date night. AWESOME!!!!!

I came here with high expectations of a truly unique experience with the fusion of two of my favorite ethnic foods- Indian and Latin. It was underwhelming at best. On a Lollapalooza Saturday (potentially one of the busiest weekends for restaurants in Chicago) the restaurant had a many tables open which I thought was really odd. It took a while for us to get served, which made sense as there really was only two employees there! One waitress made our drinks and served everything while another employee was the chef and also helped serve food items. The restaurant was also silent... the only music or audio throughout was that of the conversations of the other dinner guests or the bass of rockit next door. All in all a very weird experience. The staff were courteous, but overall the food was just so so. The pani poori drink was cool in conception but after a few sips I couldn't finish it as the flavor profile was just too strong. I wouldn't come here again, unless chef/ownership changes.
Great ambiance, decent food. Service is above par and staff works with you to accommodate but parties.
Good. Food  guy who. Work. There good  service
great food. great service. Benji is the best.

Great food, even better cocktails. We sampled every single one of the cocktails since we were a big group. All of them were good. I was partial towards the tamarindo Martini. The food was also very tasty. You will enjoy it if you think of it as Latin American food with some Indian flavors rather than the other way around! Very swank interiors too. Taking a star off since we had to wait almost an hour despite having reservations.
Very good food.  Lovely service.  Vegan, Vegetarian, some gluten free, some dairy free, some carnivores - that was our family.  All happy at the end.

Great food and a good concept, but absolutely ridiculous and inattentive service. How on earth they charge a 20% mandatory service charge completely fails me because we waited forever for our food and barely even saw our server. Ridiculous.

One waiter serving the entire floor on a Saturday night - Shocking! Took 45 mins for waiter to even swing by and ask for drinks. It took hour and half before we were served the entree. Not sure why this place has even "sub par" rating. Horrible experience with ok food. There are many better option in Chi town for classy and delicious Indian food. Not much of a Latin fare. DISAPPOINTED!
It is a very safe area and a beautiful location

The service is very good. The concept of Latin and India is quite confusing though and the food doesn't really bring it out. The appetizers were good, but the entrees left a lot to be desired. The Thali is well priced for the amount of food, but our main courses were bland.

My wife and I had very high hopes for this restaurant but wanted to save it for a special occasion.  We were going to go there for Valentine's Day. The menu was fixed for the night. Every meal had meat so we asked for the vegetarian menu. They were going to remove the meat from every option (lobster, oysters lamb, beef) and charge the exact same price.  We were very disappointed and left.
Not what it used to be :( food was decent, cocktails could use some rethinking.

Indian-Latin Fusion! Excellent service, food had so much flavor, and atmosphere was elegant. The portions are good size for price. Wine flight was awesome. We went during restaurant week & had the special menu. My fiancé has dairy allergy and they where very accommodating. Thank you for a great first experience.

It's been two hours since I got here (very hungry ) and I still don't see food. I see many other customers that got here a way after me and they are done eating dinner. I can't talk about the taste of the food because I haven't try it. It's not even rush hour or anything. I totally disapprove this place regardless of the actual food. Don't come here.

I say it's okay. Service can certainly take away from an experience. We received good service when we received it. But our waiter disappeared several times tonight. "He must be the hardest working man in the rest bus!" LOL Attended restaurant week 2017 had the Empanada to start (not on the regular menu), the Blackened Tamarind Ribs as my entree, and the Star Anise Tres Leches Jar as the dessert. Interesting concept, "fusion" a combination of Indian and Latin flavors. Who knew they would complement each other so well! If your up for an adventure and $18 cocktails (Bollywood Item Number-YUMMM!!), this is the spot. Great place for date night BTW. Kind of a grown and sexy decor!
Pani Puri Margarita is so good!
Great flavors on the Indian side.... More of a tapas tasting plates.

Really good food and great service. All dishes were well executed, interesting flavor mixes and delicious. Could not believe that there were not more people there. Prices were pretty good too, not cheap but reasonable
Fast service and creative menu

Vermillion offers very interesting food in a trendy, upscale atmosphere with a nice soundtrack.  They bill their food as a fusion of Indian and Latin, but it seemed to lean much more to Indian, although none of the items were traditional Indian, each had a unique and interesting spin.  We tried an extensive assortment of tapas, appetizers, and one entree, and enjoyed all of them. There is also an interesting wine list with about half the selections available by the glass.  Service was friendly and attentive.
The best Indian fusion restaurant I have ever been to.

Go here if you are not hungry and if you want to enjoy food as art rather than eat tasty filling food. We had to add salt and pepper to give some life to the food. If you think you have seen small portions already,  you are going to be in for a surprise.
The staff are very friendly and nice! Especially one specific buzzer! Andre!! Super awesome! Food is great!!!! Just loved it!!

review for 12/31/15 Party " Really wastage of money and time.. Didn't see any experience of DJ like it looks like the DJ didnt come and then the restaurant staff was playing the songs... He was playing full songs... Highly disappointed ...never recommended in future.
If you looking for real Indian food then don't even thing about this place. Worse food I ever eat. Stay away from this place.

Randomly found this gem! Had a great experience, waitstaff was very helpful and friendly. Mikey took the time to really explain some of their more elaborate creations and chat with us evening though it was nearly closing time. Food was EXCELLENT. Steak and chicken melted in my mouth and the traditional spices were on point. Loved the vibe and deco, great place for special events as they have private tables. Will be back!
Sangria, Sara and Benjamin best in Chicago!

I am a concierge at a 4 star hotel downtown. It is my job to get to know restaurants in the area so that I can recommend them to my guests. I tried Vermilion after realizing fusion options in the River North area are kind of scarce, so that I could have a possible option for my guests who are interested in something different. While the menu at Vermilion is certainly out of the ordinary, I will never be sending any of my guests to this restaurant. Service was very much lacking. My waitress knew the menu very well but she wasn't friendly or inviting and she was not very attentive either.  The food was okay at best. I had their signature lobster portuguese & chimichurri new york strip surf and turf. The lobster was disgusting. It was very dry and tasted like it may have been frozen at some point. The steak was flavorful, but very tough and chewy. I have to say I did enjoy the mixed flavors of everything but the texture and lack of quality meat was very disappointing. One thing I will say is that they had some very good cocktails. The drinks were the best part about the meal.  I know this next part isn't very helpful for anyone who isn't a concierge, but typically when a concierge is visiting a restaurant for the first time, it is customary for the restaurant to offer a discount or sometimes comp the entire meal. Neither of these options were offered even after I presented my business card. I understand that restaurants cannot always accommodate this but SOME kind of effort to make a good impression may have persuaded me to send them some business. Unfortunately this was not the case and I will never send a guest to this restaurant, because I fear that they may have a similar experience to mine, and I would look like I don't know what I'm talking about.  Sorry, Vermillion. I had high hopes and was rooting for you, but in the end I was severely let down.

This is probably the worst Indian restaurant I have eaten in my life. Food is most likely from microwaved packaged stuff you can get at Indian grocery store. The service also needs help. When I went there there just two other customers yet it took more than 45 minutes to get my appetizers and even longer to get meal. Please please avoid this place if you love your stomach and your money.
They haven't learned how to cook. Terrible Indian Food. Fusion doesn't mean accept my Lack of Basic cooking skills. Send them to cooking school guys.
The taste profiles lacked flavor and were all under spiced. The service was good, but slow.

DO NOT EVER GO HERE!! Our group ordered 5 appetizers between 9 of us. They brought and charged us for several orders of each appetizer. We asked for separate checks before the meal, but were brought a singular check 3 hours after the meal began (the food took ages to arrive). When they split the checks, they swiped the wrong cards with the wrong bills. Finally, they fraudulently added $5-30 to each check.  I was in town for a competition. The concierge recommended this place.  The group was very excited to try this place- Indian-Latin Fusion?! Sounded amazing.  There was interesting food, but I would not say it was worth the price by a long shot.  We are all now dealing with the FRAUDULENT CHARGES!

DO NOT GO HERE. The service was awful, we were completely taken advantage of and I am calling my bank immediately. Our entire group was overcharged--after the gratuity was already included, the waitress put an extra tip WITHOUT PUTTING IT ON THE RECEIPT. My receipt says one number ( the correct number ) and my bank was charged another $30. The waitress did not deserve any tip let alone the gratuity on top of a tip of her choosing. Every single person in our group was fraudulently overcharged in this way.  After reading several other yelp reviews, I don't understand why they haven't been reported to the BBB by now for this very thing. Disgusting, unprofessional and damn near tortious. If this comment is removed, I will call the BBB myself, as will every single other person in my group and file a formal complaint. DO NOT GO HERE.
Excellent place. Nice food, good ambience and service.

Went there on a quiet and rainy Sunday night, and had an excellent meal - the server was very attentive and all of the dishes were extremely well prepared and delicious. Living in London I eat quite a lot of Indian and Indian-inspired food and this spot definitely stands out! I'd highly recommend the duck vindaloo arepas and the artichoke pakora.
Tiny portions, lukewarm food and spotty service. We spent $76 here and left hungry.

We were a party of ten with a reservation at Vermilion on a DEAD Monday evening (2/24/2014).  We all enjoyed the food and service.  It was very good.  However, the sad part about this evening is that it ended with an issue with the valet parking.  This valet was recommended by the restaurant at $12.00.  When we arrived, we were informed that it was $14.00 with a curfew of 3 hours.  Annoying, but okay.  We were 2 minutes over our valet time restrictions and were told it would be $20.00.  Very annoying, especially since we spent over 2 minutes waiting for our car.  We had just spent close to $1,000.00 to eat at Vermilion and now we were being gouged for having used the valet they recommended.  We could afford to pay the valet, but we had a principle to stand up for (not everyone is a sucker).  Telling our waitress about this swindle got us an apology - let’s hope it gets attention on a higher level than “I’m sorry” so that other patrons aren’t duped into overpaying an absurd valet service.  We told the waitress we would never be back and we won’t.  The valet experience negated the whole good food experience.  Too bad for them, since we could have brought them several more visits of ten or more people in the future.

Indian Latin cuisine, comfortable atmosphere and pleasant staff. I ordered the chicken kabob for an appetizer and the chili-glazed blackened tamarind ribs for an entree.  The ribs were amazing! For dessert I had a slice of the goat cheese cheesecake.  It was scrumptious.  I would go back just for the cheesecake and the ribs too.  Highly recommended.

Latin-Indian fusion that works, with both omnivore and vegetarian menus. If you are an omnivore, be sure to try these small plates: duck vindaloo arepas, the blue corn crusted scallops, and the coconut chili mussels (heaven for the tongue), and the braised duck in michoacan mole entrée. The heat in the keralan red curry of fish varies, but has never overwhelmed my non-native tongue. I've eaten there with precise vegetarians, who came away singing praises. But don't take my word for it, try it yourself. Good wine list, friendly staff, genteel (not speedy) service. Relax, eat, enjoy.
As my rating says restaurant is Ok..neither good nor bad..

This is by far one of my favorite places in the city! Super unique cocktails and the food is perfect. I am obsessed with kale because if Vermillion. The pickled kale was beyond perfect. I can't wait to go back!
One of my favorite spots for Indian cuisine. A little on the fancy side for my taste, but really great food.
Good food and good service
Went here for restaurant week.  Great service and very inventive food.  Very expensive.  But a good place for a special occasion.

I experienced Vermilion's "tasting menu" it was a provocative adventure through flavor, ending with the most delicious lobster, I see why the server made it a point to mention the highly lauded dish.  My service was flawless, my server was so knowledgeable about what he was doing.  The decor hasn't changed, but I don't think it needs to, very appealing.  I can't wait to come back!
Very good food. Indian-Spanish fusion. On the price side, but a great for a special occassion.
Awesome. The food was fantastic, good heat level. Service was great, even a bonus wine with the pairing, which had 4 surprisingly tasty wines for only 40 bucks. Pricey, but worth every penny.
What a joke, definitely NOT a value for the price of lunch without ANY drinks. As the proof, there was 0 - none of patrons for entire time 12:45 - 2:30pm we were there!?
Have to have some wine with servings that are simply put - greatest fusion food that Columbus would have fancied !
not worth the money
Very nice Indian fusion. Excellent service, very knowledgeable and helpful staff to help with the menu suggestions!
very nice place food was mix of spicy and cool.

This place was a bit too (for lack of a better word) stiff for my liking. I never really felt relaxed here and even though the food was okay, the serving sizes were small, even for a nice place. Overall, it really came down to me not enjoying the environment or vibe I got from the wait staff.

Did not like this place!  Went on a Groupon for a 5 course meal and was very disappointed.  Food took forever.   Instead of having our courses staggered they made "an executive decision" to bring it all out on one plate.  My friend who ordered a $24 dish had better food then my $120.00 tasting menu!  We all left very unhappy with the results.  In addition we were forced to pay tax on $120.00 meals instead of the $65.00 we paid for our Groupons.
